meanings.definition: The state or quality of being contrary; opposition or resistance.
meanings.sent1: The contrariety between their opinions led to a heated argument.
meanings.sent2: The contrariety of their beliefs made it difficult to find common ground.
meanings.sent3: The contrariety in their tastes for ice cream flavors was quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: The contrariety in their personalities was like oil and water, never mixing well.
meanings.sent5: The stark contrariety between their fashion styles made them stand out in the crowd.

meanings.definition: A contrary or opposite quality or characteristic.
meanings.sent1: Her kindness was a welcome contrariety to the usual coldness of the office.
meanings.sent2: The contrariety of his actions puzzled those around him.
meanings.sent3: The contrariety of the cat enjoying a bath was quite amusing to watch.
meanings.sent4: The contrariety of the situation was like a puzzle waiting to be solved.
meanings.sent5: The sudden contrariety in the weather caught everyone by surprise.
